snippet: The president urged Congress to allocate an estimated $60 billion over 10 years for an initiative that would be based in part on a Tennessee program.
abstract: Pres Obama urges Congress to adopt plan that will make community college tuition-free nationwide; critics warn that some public 4-year colleges could see steep drops in enrollment.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA
byline.contributor: Michael D. Shear reported from Knoxville, and Richard Pérez-Peña from New York. Tamar Lewin contributed reporting from New York and Julie Hirschfeld Davis from Washington..

lead_paragraph: The president urged Congress to allocate an estimated $60 billion over 10 years for an initiative that would be based in part on a Tennessee program.

headline.main: Obama, in Tennessee, Begins Selling His Community College Tuition Plan
headline.print_headline: Obama, in Tennessee, Begins Selling His Community College Tuition Plan
